result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernardo Garcia Tentzohua was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bernardo Garcia Tentzohua is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bernardo Garcia Tentzohua was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with Pepin County Case No. 2015CM15

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernardo Garcia Tentzohua

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
15CM15, 15CM17.  Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty.  Ordered that $1416.30 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements, said sums to be paid to said Atty. by Pepin County and Pepin County shall be reimbursed by defendant as previously ordered, with the defendant being credited for any sums already paid to the Pepin County Clerk of Court as part of his court-ordered attorney obligations.
Attorney Fees Assessed in 2015CM15.
Petition for Payment for County Appointed Attorney Fees

Judge advises defendant of elements of disorderly conduct/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty, dismiss other charge.  Sentence to 10 days in the PCJ and waive court costs.

Defendant Bernardo Garcia Tentzohua in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Certified Spanish Interpreter appears in person.  Counsel informs court of agreement.  In 15CM15, defendant will plead to OWI 2nd & OAR in exchange State moves to dismiss obstructing & operate with PAC.  In 15CM17 defendant will plead to disorderly, State moves to dismiss obstructing.

Defendant Bernardo Garcia Tentzohua in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Darrius Torres in person.  Interpreter Sworn.  Atty Morgan requests a status conference 1 mo. out, parties working on an agreement.   Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Bernardo Garcia Tentzohua in court.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish Interpreter, Sally Nichols appears by phone.  Mr. Morgan represents defendant in 15CM15 requests cases track together.  Court appoints Atty Morgan on this case.  Judge advises defendant of charges and rights.  Mr. Morgan requests an adjournment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
